There should be no place for corruption and bribery in Azerbaijan.
All state officials should hear, know, and act so that they can always be upset with the state and the people.
A civil servant is a servant of the people. I am the first servant of the people and all state officials should work.
Great news for @bombardier and Derby with the £1billion Crossrail deal. Our #LongTermEconomicPlan means more jobs, security and opportunity.
Statement by Prime Minister Mr. Antonis Samaras after meeting to relieve earthquake victims in Kefalonia http://t.co/4rjkNRaFxN
Every government official must understand his / her responsibility.
Every government official must work cleanly, be in public, be modest, businessman, patriotic, not bribe (dvm)
.... should not pretend to be superior to the people, to respect the areas in which he or she works, to be honest and faithful to the Motherland.
No outside circle should be affected. Here are the basic principles.
I demand from every public official that he follows these principles.
In the coming years, people infected with bribery will be punished very seriously.
Over the next five years, Azerbaijan should be an exemplary country in the fight against corruption and bribery.
Over a year, ASAN Service has made over one million applications.
Full transparency has been provided, cultural service and respect for the Azerbaijani citizen
Therefore, the functions of "ASAN service" will further expand.
Those who are in direct contact with all human beings should live by these principles.
ICT application in the regions will continue in the coming years. Broadband internet should be available for each city.
The number of Internet users is more than 70 percent, and is rapidly increasing.
Therefore, the development of information and communication technologies in every city has a great meaning.
We must try to bring the products produced in Azerbaijan to the market and the relevant government agencies should regulate this work.
Products that are produced in Azerbaijan are imported from abroad. There must also be strict control.
If we produce this product ourselves, why should we import it from abroad, and why should we create conditions? "
Food security in Azerbaijan should be ensured at 100% domestic production.
Implementation of infrastructure projects over the next five years should be completed.
10 years ago in Baku, only 29 percent of the population was receiving water for 24 hours, at present this figure has reached 78 percent.
But in the city like Baku, there should be 100 percent, in all other cities as well as in the villages
